section.title: Overview
section.p: Bob has a car with a SIM that connects to the network. This SIM, owned by the car manufacturer, is used for the given purposes:

ul.li: To send statistics and diagnostics either to the car manufacturer or the service garage.
To provide wifi hotspot for all devices when travelling in the car. For example, Bob has an iPhone that uses the wifi hotspot provided by the car SIM.

section.p: A prepaid data bucket is associated with the car SIM and the data consumed by the iPhone is charged from this prepaid data bucket.
There are two accounts that uses the devices to avail the wifi hotspot provided by the car SIM:

ul.li: The first one is the car manufacturer account, which is charged per number of lines of data consumption. For data usage, the car SIM has access to this account subscription. All the data traffic is directed from the car SIM to the car manufacturer server and data consumption is charged against the car manufacturer account subscription. The charges are paid by the car manufacturer. The car manufacturer account subscription is either shared among several SIMs or there can be a single subscription per SIM.
The second one is the account owned by Bob, which is charged for an additional device (for example, iPhone) under a subscription for data consumption.

section.p: For data consumption, each device either has a distinct service or it shares an existing internet plan with other devices. Both the options for data consumption are same and the car appears as a unique device.

ul.li: Rating-Group equal to Statistics. In this case, verify that the data consumption is charged from the bucket associated with the car manufacturer account.
Rating-Group not equal to Statistics. In this case, verify that the data consumption is charged from the bucket associated with the account owned by Bob.

section.title: Provisioning

note.p: Ensure that after creating a record, you distribute it to ME. Otherwise, the provisioning will not be successful.
